G  D  Em  F  C  D are the chords to the song over and over, (unless you are listening
to a live version cause the end is different).


[Verse]

[ch]F[/ch]                         [ch]C[/ch]             [ch]D[/ch]
    Would you still remember me
[ch]G[/ch]              [ch]D[/ch]           [ch]Em[/ch]
    For I must be travelin on now

At the start of the chorus, for one beat of the second G chord, the note C is added at the first fret of the
B string, making the chord a Gsus4. It's hard to explain but if you listen to the song it's easy to pick up.

The G chords at the end of the verses carry on into the start of the next verse. However at the end the
verses before the chorus there is a 1 bar pause in the music, again it'll be easier to work out by listening
to the song :)

name: The Ballad Of Curtis Loew
tuning: E A D G B E

content.text:
[Verse]
[ch]E[/ch]                                [ch]Bm[/ch]
Well I used to wake the mornin' before the rooster crowed
[ch]E[/ch]                            [ch]A[/ch]                 [ch]D[/ch]
Searchin for soda bottles to get myself some dough
[ch]E[/ch]                             [ch]Bm[/ch]
Brung em down to the corner, down to the country store
[ch]A[/ch]                                                   [ch]E[/ch]
Cash em in and give my money to a man named Curtis Lowe

[ch]E[/ch]              [ch]Bm[/ch]              [ch]A[/ch]          [ch]E[/ch]
Ol' Curt was a black man with white curly hair
[ch]E[/ch]              [ch]Bm[/ch]               [ch]A[/ch]              [ch]E[/ch]
When he had a fifth of wine he did not have a care
[ch]E[/ch]                      [ch]Bm[/ch]            [ch]A[/ch]                  [ch]E[/ch]
He used to own an old dobro used to play it 'cross his knee
[ch]E[/ch]            [ch]Bm[/ch]                   [ch]A[/ch]               [ch]E[/ch]
I'd give Ol' Curt my money, he'd play all day for me


[Chorus]
[ch]A[/ch]                       [ch]E[/ch]
Play me a song, Curtis Lowe, hey Curtis Lowe
[ch]A[/ch]                           [ch]E[/ch]
I got your drinkin' money, tune up your dobro
[ch]A[/ch]                                     [ch]E[/ch]               [ch]D[/ch]
People said you was useless but them people all were fools
[ch]E[/ch]                         [ch]Bm[/ch]                [ch]A[/ch]            [ch]E[/ch]
Cause Curtis Lowe was the finest picker to ever play the blues

[Verse]
[ch]E[/ch]               [ch]Bm[/ch]  [ch]A[/ch]           [ch]E[/ch]
He looked to be 60, maybe I was 10
[ch]E[/ch]            [ch]Bm[/ch]               [ch]A[/ch]             [ch]E[/ch]
Mama used to whoop me but I'd go see him again
[ch]E[/ch]                   [ch]Bm[/ch]            [ch]A[/ch]                 [ch]E[/ch]
I'd clap my hands, stomp my feets tryin' to stay in time
[ch]E[/ch]             [ch]Bm[/ch]              [ch]A[/ch]                     [ch]E[/ch]
He'd play me song or two then take another drink of wine

[Chorus]
[ch]E[/ch]               [ch]Bm[/ch]            [ch]A[/ch]           [ch]E[/ch]
On the day Ol' Curtis died nobody came to pray
[ch]E[/ch]            [ch]Bm[/ch]                         [ch]A[/ch]                 [ch]E[/ch]
Old preacher said some words and they chucked him in the clay
[ch]E[/ch]           [ch]Bm[/ch]       [ch]A[/ch]                        [ch]E[/ch]
He lived a lifetime playin' the black man's blues
[ch]E[/ch]                  [ch]Bm[/ch]                   [ch]A[/ch]             [ch]E[/ch]
And on the day he lost his life that's all he had to lose

[ch]A[/ch]                      [ch]E[/ch]
Play me a song Curtis Lowe, hey Curtis Lowe
[ch]A[/ch]                            [ch]E[/ch]
I wish that you was here so everyone would know
[ch]A[/ch]                                     [ch]E[/ch]               [ch]D[/ch]
People said you was useless but them people all were fools
       [ch]E[/ch]                  [ch]Bm[/ch]               [ch]A[/ch]             [ch]E[/ch]
Cause Curtis, you're the finest picker to ever play the blues

[ch]E[/ch]   [ch]Bm[/ch]    [ch]A[/ch]    [ch]E[/ch]


Rock on, Ronnie.

hello : )

here is my interpretation of lying is the most fun by panic! at the disco, i play it on
havent tried it on electric yet, its a pretty amazing song and the way i like to play it
reaally easy : )

note: it sounds good when u play it slowly, the verses should be played with a down,
up down up down, down, down, up down up down strumming pattern to every chord, the choruses
be just constant strumming, and the wierd bridge bit of dance to this beat and the last 
u have to listen to the song for strumming timing, but u can play it with constant
you want : )
